setting.location: Polish capital Warsaw under Russian partition, panoramic view from Vistula River valley, Congress Poland
setting.weather: Misty spring morning with golden sunrise breaking through fog

scene.mainElements: Panoramic view of 19th century Warsaw awakening with church spires piercing through morning mist, smoke rising from chimneys of merchant houses, and the Vistula River flowing peacefully with wooden barges and fishing boats
scene.details: Gothic and baroque church towers dominate the skyline, three-story kamienica buildings line the riverbank with their ornate facades catching first sunlight, gas street lamps still burning as dawn breaks, horse-drawn carriages beginning to appear on cobblestone streets, market vendors setting up stalls near the riverside, no text or letters visible
scene.background: Rolling Polish countryside visible beyond city limits, Orthodox church domes glinting in distance, factory smokestacks on the horizon beginning their daily work
scene.atmosphere: Peaceful yet industrious morning atmosphere, the city stirring to life with promise of commerce and daily struggles, golden light transforming grey buildings into warm amber tones

composition.cameraAngle: Wide elevated shot from riverbank looking across the Vistula toward the city
composition.focus: The interplay between old Warsaw's church spires and new industrial elements
composition.depth: River and boats in foreground, city buildings and streets in middle ground, countryside and factories in far background
